description:
Mike Lynch, co-founder of Darktrace and Autonomy, is among six people presumed dead after the superyacht, Bayesian, sank off the coast of Sicily early Monday.

The post Darktrace Co-founder Mike Lynch Presumed Dead After Superyacht Sinks appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Darktrace Co-founder Mike Lynch Presumed Dead After Superyacht Sinks

description:
Backdoor in millions of contactless cards made by Shanghai Fudan Microelectronics allows instantaneous cloning of RFID smart cards used to open office doors and hotel rooms around the world.

The post Major Backdoor in Millions of RFID Cards Allows Instant Cloning appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Major Backdoor in Millions of RFID Cards Allows Instant Cloning

description:
A critical vulnerability in the GiveWP WordPress plugin could be exploited for remote code execution and arbitrary file deletion.

The post Critical Flaw in Donation Plugin Exposed 100,000 WordPress Sites to Takeover appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Critical Flaw in Donation Plugin Exposed 100,000 WordPress Sites to Takeover

description:
Fabric Cryptography has raised $33 million in Series A funding to create the Verifiable Processing Unit (VPU), a new chip for cryptography.

The post Fabric Cryptography Raises $33 Million for VPU Chip appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Fabric Cryptography Raises $33 Million for VPU Chip

description:
Ransomware payments in H1 2024 totaled nearly $460 million and $1.58 billion have been stolen in cryptocurrency heists. 

The post Ransomware Victims Paid $460 Million in First Half of 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Ransomware Victims Paid $460 Million in First Half of 2024

description:
Multiple vulnerabilities in Microsoft applications for macOS could be exploited to send emails, leak sensitive information, and escalate privileges.

The post Cisco, Microsoft Disagree on Severity of macOS App Vulnerabilities  appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Cisco, Microsoft Disagree on Severity of macOS App Vulnerabilities

description:
For years, many CISOs have struggled to influence their development cohort on the importance of putting security first.

The post How Exceptional CISOs Are Igniting the Security Fire in Their Development Team appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: How Exceptional CISOs Are Igniting the Security Fire in Their Development Team

description:
Clark Construction has been tasked with building the 630,000 square foot sustainable state-of-the-art facility for CISA.

The post CISA to Get New $524 Million Headquarters in DC, Backed by Inflation Reduction Act Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: CISA to Get New $524 Million Headquarters in DC, Backed by Inflation Reduction Act Funding

description:
F5’s latest quarterly security notification includes nine advisories, including four for high-severity vulnerabilities in BIG-IP and NGINX Plus.

The post F5 Patches High-Severity Vulnerabilities in BIG-IP, NGINX Plus appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: F5 Patches High-Severity Vulnerabilities in BIG-IP, NGINX Plus

description:
The assessment from agencies was the first time the U.S. government assigned blame for hacks that have raised anew the threat of foreign election interference.

The post US Intelligence Officials Say Iran is to Blame for Hacks Targeting Trump, Biden-Harris Campaigns appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: US Intelligence Officials Say Iran is to Blame for Hacks Targeting Trump, Biden-Harris Campaigns
